title: Worth 40K Every Bit
review:
Excellent service from Flipkart in terms of delivery within 24 hrs of purchase and Installation from Jeeves within 24 hrs from Delivery.

TV looks stunning. It is ultra slim and the display is great. You will enjoy 4k and HD content very well on this TV at the same time you will hate to watch SD content from the DTH services. So better opt for HD channels if you buy this TV.

Sound output on TV speakers is not all that great. Tried all different settings but could not find the optimal sound experience. However it is not so bad either. I can live with it. I mostly watch movies by connecting my JBL Everest BT headphones, so that helps me. There is no lag on Bluetooth.

Patchwall is a mixed experience. I feel it is more of a gimmick. There are only 4 apps pre-installed, SonyLiv, Voot kids, Hungama and Alt Balaji. There is also you tube with has been sideloaded already. I have sideloaded opera browser which works excellent. The STB integration using IR blaster does not work well all the time with Videocon D2h. I greatly miss Prime video TV app. Hope MItv gets it soon as an update.

Mi Bluetooth remote is also good with minimal buttons. However within some apps it becomes difficult to manage with those fewer buttons. You will feel the need for more. I found a fix for this. The best feature I found is the MI Remote Android app. Install the app in your android smartphone and it works over WiFi network. You can use the MI Remote app to control your TV. Best part is you rotate your phone and the TV content will be mirrored on your phone screen. You can then use your smartphone as a touchscreen device for your TV. Use it to know it. Excellent feature.

Overall I am satisfied with the buy. Thanks Mi for the excellent product and Flipkart for the great service!

Cheers!
AR

title: Brilliant

PROS:

- PRICE 
- 4k HDR 10 BIT 
- android TV
- Fluid ,lag free interface
- 60 Hz refresh rate

- 3 HDMI + 2 USB

CONS:

- SOFTWARE - Patchwall is really bad at this point of time (there no YouTube ,Amazon prime and Netflix )
  APP SUPPORT -  All the app's need to be sideloaded which is very inconvenient
- No internet browser pre installed 
- No Google play services installed , so none of the modern Google apps work on this TV 
-Use apps which doesn't use play services like silk browser or any others 
- Apps which i tested on the TV and are working
       - MX media player 
       - Opera browser
       - Es file explorer 
       - YouTube (Android TV version) works but search option        doesn't work , use your phone as remote 

- SOUND - good only when you install it on table top but on wall mount it's not up to the mark 

FEW MENTIONS: 

- PANEL - Black levels could have been better, Contrast is also not up to the mark but can be adjusted for better image quality , Viewing angle is not that great as advertised (178°) there is a colour shift but can be noticed only when more than (100°) so not that much of a problem , Bezel is thin on the outside the glass , but when ON you can notice the Bezel is present to some extent inside the glass 

- REMOTE -  very basic, but the TV support both mouse and keyboard so it's fine , support for other remotes is not know at this point of time

- UPSCALING - Only full hd and 4k content looks good on the TV ,others look bad because of badly optimised upscaler and the size of the TV

- AAA BATTERIES for the remote are NOT INCLUDED in the package, which is very strange so make sure you have 2 ready 

GAMING - Most of the games via console looks great , but there are some fast pace action game which at times show ghosting 
While gaming make sure that display profile is in Game mode as it has dynamic contrast option, 4k HDR games actually works better than normal 1080p games

- Mi TV remote app is good , it has more functionality than the standard remote it self , inorder to make it work Both TV and phone should be on same WiFi connection    

- PORTS postion is very bad, it very difficult to reach and plug in the Cables, these is very less clearance near ports so it might damage the cables if care is not taken while plugging them to the Tv, it is almost IMPOSSIBLE to plug in a cable after it is wall mounted - So plug the cables before wall mounting the TV and if possible keep usb Hub for later use

Overall it's a great purchase for the best price , don't except too good quality especially if you are owning good TV before but for people upgrading from normal TV it will surely make a difference

title: Reviewing after a month to highlight a few key points....
review:
This is my review after using the TV for a month. Don't want to elaborate much about basic stuff already reviewed by others. Will highlight a couple of key points not said by others.

Got this TV on the very first sale and the installation happened the very next day, But I  took my time to compare this with my Samsung Full HD 3D TV which I'm using since the past 5 years.

This is an EDGE-LIT LED TV and the backlight is not distributed evenly and you can surely make this out when the room is completely dark. Coming to the clarity as said by others is very good with good color reproduction, But it lags in contrast and dimming as with other high end televisions. The screen is not able to adjust the backlight at different points as with the micro dimming feature in SAMSUNG.

And the next thing is the sound clarity which is good but lacks in Treble and Bass. The speakers are designed only to watch the normal cable television channels and not for Dolby audio.

Connecting external speakers to it is difficult as the regular 3.5mm Audio out port is missing.  You can connect an external speaker by two options. One is with Bluetooth, But you'll face an audio lag. The second option is to use a HDMI audio extractor which can be connected to the HDMI ARC(Audio return channel) port at the back. This is not available with MI and has to be sourced from third party.

Coming to the conclusion. If this is you're first big television, Then you'll find the picture clarity amazing. But if you've already used other brands like SAMSUNG, SONY or LG, Then you'll find the picture clarity much better in these with Full HD than the 4K clarity in MI. The normal FHD to 4K upscaling is not good and blurs the picture. You can get a crisp picture only with 4K HDR. As said by others this is only a budget TV and you'll definitely feel it's worth for the money spent.

title: MI TV 4 High on Expectations Low on Practicality
review:
Practical problems with MI TV 4:

Bought MI TV 4 on first day of sale. It got delivered and installed in a day...phew that was fast. This excitement lasts only till the TV is lit up and "patchwall" welcome screen came on. After this point I hate to call it a smart tv. Reason: It only has Sonly Liv, Hungama Play and Voot pre-installed on it. Largely the content (note: latest) that I intend to watch on Hungama Play was available on rental of Rs.70 to Rs.120 (range) for 3 days; rental model in 2018 Seriously!! Sony Liv has least interesting content among the 3 and content is open to access for first 6 months (free subscription). Popular video platforms are not pre-installed.

When wall mounted, side loading via pen drive or to that matter connecting any cord to the Gigantic TV is not at all possible. There is hardly any space and visibility between wall and TV panel to attach the cords. Given the thinness of the panel, it looks very delicate to demount it from the wall.

Xiaomi India, if you are reading this, request you to shout out to your fans regarding your plans to get more content for MI TV 4. I have been using and advocating about your mobiles for past 3 to 4 years. As a fan, my benchmark for this TV was higher in terms of practicality.

Who can possibly buy this TV?
Those who know side loading the apps on TV and this can help maximize the experience.
People with loads of 4K / HD content. Given the size of display, regular content does not look good and this set is just not made for regular content.
Those who intend to use TV as table top. That way you have complete and safe access to ports for connecting content sources.
Those who live in a owned house or those who do not often shift from a rented accommodation. Jeeves currently does not offer reinstallation service according to installation engineer.

title: Really Nice
review:
The delivery and installation were very quick - Great delivery & installation experience.

The TV display & audio quality is very good at this price point.

Some of the (software) issues I faced so far:
- The IR blaster didn't work with my latest Airtel Internet TV set top box (perhaps my STB doesn't support IR, I couldn't find clear documentation). It works via HDMI CEC to control channels on STB (prev/next only as there are no numbers on MI TV remote), but then I can't use the Sensy remote application in CEC mode. So I gave up on integrated remote for my STB. This seems like an issue that could be fixed in software - My Airtel Internet TV STB has Bluetooth remote. So if MI TV remote can intelligently pair between the TV & STB, this can be made to work.

- The AI recommendations are not filtered for children (no option in settings), take care when viewing with family. Initial recommendations were really vulgar content before it even built a user profile. There was no login option, so it basically started with wrong default adult profile, so I was really surprised & furious. This needs a definite software fix with option for parental controls. MI needs to understand that Phones are personal devices, and TVs in the living room are shared devices.

- 3-4 seconds Beep noise when switching to a HD channel (audio decoder taking time to switch, but they didn't mute the output in the meantime)

- Unpredictable delay in audio decoder. I have SPDIF optical output connected from my STB to my Home theatre (my default viewing setup). I use both TV audio (better vocals) + Home theater (Better subwoofer) simultaneously. My Airtel STB has option to control the delay between the two decoders so that user can synchronise them correctly. I could configure it once, but the delay keeps varying on MI TV between different channels / even with the same channel. This causes too much echo. I can't keep adjusting the delay between the two decoders frequently.

The software needs some time to mature. For the current low price, this TV is a very good buy.

title: So close!
review:
So I managed to order this from flipkart when the second flash sale took place. The TV was delivered the next day and on request was installed the same day by the fantastic team over at Jeeves. Have listed the pros and cons of the TV below;

PROS
Stunning design. And so thin! 

Picture quality is very good. It's not as crisp as the displays on the higher end tv's, but compared to my Dad's 55 inch Sony LED from three years ago, it's exactly the same! Which is saying something at this price point! 

The remote of the TV looks exactly like the Fire Stick and it works wonderfully. This sort of a remote and user interface makes so much sense. The patchwall UI is designed in the same tile manner that the Amazon's fire stick is. It's a refreshingly new way to interact with your TV. 

CONS 
I don't have quite a problem with the inbuilt speakers as people do but yes the trebble seems boosted and the mids feel compressed. Volume isn't the problem. Quality is. 

Lack of modern audio ports is by BIGGEST issue with this TV. No headphone jack, no optical out! It makes absolutely no sense! They have given the option to connect via Bluetooth but that usually results in an audio lag causing AV to go out sync. I really wish they had another option rather than a Coaxial connector. Home theater is lying unconnected because an optical to Coaxial converter is so hard to find. This is actually my only grouse with this TV. 

All in all if you're looking for a good BIG display and have a third party entertainment streaming device (apple tv, fire stick, chrome cast etc) don't think twice! If you figure the audio bit out or know where to get a damn convertor, drop me a message!

title: Overall a good buy for this screen and price but not best
review:
MI has done a great thing bringing this to India. I am sure many like me will buy and enjoy it 
Although there are few good and bad things that come with this TV which I noticed

Pros:

Excellent design and super slim

Best price 

4k quality playing with the Hard drive connected is good .. ( You will see few frames drop now and then for sure )

It has decent colours not greatest not bad would say 7/10 

UI scrolling is smooth with a simple remote provided along

Overall a great buy for those who don't want to spend a very high price for a TV


Cons:

Streaming 4k with youtube app is not allowed just yes so you will have to settle with 1080p max for now 

Netflix and other streaming apps I was not able to install and play which is kinda bummer

Maybe with an update, they will add more streaming apps to the list 

Interface hosts everything you have it connected and in kinda no order, Which is cluttery and patchy... It's confusing a lot at least for now

Picture quality for 720 and less looks ok and not a great to watch looks blurry and not very clear 

It doesn't really upscale anything I suppose... which is kinda ok as we are not paying anything premium again 

I hate the fact that MI keeps most of their product as a flash sale.. maybe just to create more hype 

I am still testing and will update the review if noticed anything new 

Note: Above things are first 3 days impressions 

HS
